Crimes.Crime_Name: Making a false statement under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant's pre-removal risk assessment (PRRA) be upheld based on new evidence or risks?
Crimes.Evidence_Type: New evidence on country conditions and personal risk
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Risk due to deteriorating conditions in Sri Lanka and status as failed refugee with forged ID
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Serious possibility of persecution, torture, or cruel treatment
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible and compelling evidence of risk
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Pre-Removal Risk Assessment (PRRA) and subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Decision_Maker: PRRA Officer and Federal Court judge
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to provide sufficient new evidence not available during initial claim
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard for establishing risk under IRPA s. 97
Crimes.Application_Factor: Changed country conditions and individual circumstances
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 96 (refugee protection), s. 97 (risk of torture/cruel treatment)
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility and insufficient evidence of risk
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to establish serious risk
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process followed according to PRRA and judicial review procedures
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Use of forged identity document acknowledged
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Central factor in rejection of claim
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application for judicial review based on new evidence and changed conditions
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada (Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration matters)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Availability and sufficiency of new evidence for PRRA
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose or substantiate risk factors earlier

Crimes.Crime_Name: Possession of a forged identity card
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Is the applicant at risk of persecution or harm upon return to Sri Lanka due to possession of a forged identity card?
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicantâ€™s credibility significantly undermined by use of forged ID
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Country condition reports and personal circumstances
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 97 of IRPA (risk of torture or cruel treatment)
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Risk associated with being a failed refugee who used forged documents
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Serious possibility of torture or death upon return
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: No concrete evidence of state targeting or systematic punishment for document fraud
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Pre-Removal Risk Assessment (PRRA) and judicial review
Crimes.Decision_Maker: PRRA Officer and Federal Court judge
Crimes.Application_Error: Inability to demonstrate direct link between forged ID and state persecution
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Risk of torture or cruel and unusual treatment or punishment under IRPA s. 97
Crimes.Application_Factor: Status as failed refugee and use of forged documentation
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether there is a foreseeable risk of harm due to forged ID
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: No substantial evidence of risk linked to forged ID
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Speculative nature of claimed risk; lack of corroborating evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Fair opportunity given to present PRRA case
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Confirmed possession and use of forged identity card
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that return would expose applicant to danger due to document fraud
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canadian immigration law and international obligations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing and adequacy of evidence submission in PRRA
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to prove nexus between document fraud and state persecution

Crimes.Violation_Type: Re-entry risk after failed refugee claim
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can a failed refugee claimant establish a new risk of persecution or danger upon return to Sri Lanka based on changed country conditions and past actions?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant claimed worsening conditions in Sri Lanka and personal risks as a returned failed refugee with forged ID
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: PRRA application denied, judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Protection from removal based on new risks
Crimes.Court_Ruling: No substantial evidence of new or credible risk
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Attempted to submit new evidence post-refusal
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Changed country conditions and personal vulnerability
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious possibility of persecution or danger under IRPA s. 97
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility, timing of evidence, and country condition trends
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Availability and admissibility of new evidence in PRRA
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Country reports, applicant testimony, previous decisions
Crimes.Application_Basis: New evidence of deteriorating conditions and personal risk profile
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Generalized country conditions without individualized risk indicators
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Prevention of removal to Sri Lanka
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to show targeted risk or state involvement
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No probable risk of torture, death, or persecution established
Crimes.Cause_Description: Dismissal due to lack of credibility and insufficient new evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: PRRA officer considered available evidence as speculative
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None directly cited; failure to meet protection thresholds
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of specific, credible, and corroborated evidence
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Use of forged ID affected truthfulness of entire claim
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal jurisdiction over immigration and refugee matters
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: General country conditions not sufficient to establish personal risk
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Risk too speculative and not supported by evidence
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
